grammarTerms.definition: A form of adjective used to compare two things
grammarTerms.example: This book is more interesting than that one.

grammarTerms.definition: A form of adjective used to compare three or more things
grammarTerms.example: This is the most beautiful place I've ever seen.

grammarTerms.definition: A unit of pronunciation having one vowel sound
grammarTerms.example: The word 'beautiful' has three syllables: beau-ti-ful.

grammarTerms.definition: A word that describes a noun

difficultWords.example: This restaurant is too expensive for me.
She is the most beautiful girl in the class.
Hanoi is more crowded than Hue.

difficultWords.definition: A number of different types of things
difficultWords.example: The supermarket has enough variety to choose from.

difficultWords.definition: An area of a town or city
difficultWords.example: John's house is the biggest in the neighborhood.

keyPhrases.definition: Used to show two things are equal
keyPhrases.example: A tiger is as dangerous as a lion.

keyPhrases.definition: Used to show two things are not equal
keyPhrases.example: London is not as big as Cairo.

keyPhrases.definition: More than necessary or wanted (negative meaning)
keyPhrases.example: This hat is too big for you!
It smells good enough to eat!

keyPhrases.definition: As much of something as needed
Used with long adjectives for comparison
keyPhrases.example: This book is more interesting than that one.

keyPhrases.definition: Used to show the highest degree
keyPhrases.example: She is the most intelligent girl in the school.

usefulExpressions.example: It smells good enough to eat!
That hat is too big for you!
